definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: become or be sweet, pleasant (NH [[מתק]], esp. Pi.; As. [matâḳu] be sweet, in deriv.; Eth. mt’uq: sweet; Aram. mtaq suck (with pleasure), [[מְתַק]] id., be sweet; Ar. mt.q (t. before q) v. smack the lips (with pleasure), mat.qah;un sweetness);—
lit. become sweet, of water (opp. [[מָרִים]]) Ex 15:25 (J);  are (i.e. taste) sweet, ´[[מַיִם גְּנוּבִים יִמ]] Pr 9:17 (fig. of delights of illicit pleasure).
= be pleasant, [[מָֽתְקוּ לוֹ]] Job 21:33 sweet (pleasant) to him are the clods of the valley (said of one resting in the grave).

suck (Aram. sense, cf. Syr. supr.) [[מְתָקוֹ רִמָּה]] Job 24:20 the worm doth suck him, feast on him (on vb. masc. cf. Ges:§ 145. 7 Kö:Synt. § 345 a Da:Synt. § 113 (b)), Di De Buhl (cf. Kau Da; also SS who render ‘ angenehm finden ’), but this sense in Heb. dub.; txt. perh. crpt. (cf. conject. by Bu Du).

definitions.title: Hiph.
definitions.body: Impf. 3 fs. [[אִם תַּמְתִּיק בְּפִיו רָעָה]] Job 20:12 if evil gives a sweet taste in his mouth (declarative Hiph.); 1 pl. [[אֲשֶׁר יַחְדָּו נַמְתִּיק סוֹד]] Ps 55:15 we who used to make sweet (our) intimacy.
